channel.title: CNN.com - Top Stories
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2015 Cable News Network LP, LLLP.

image.title: CNN.com - Top Stories
image.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

item.title: Donald Trump denies comment referred to menstruation
Fiorina: 'Women understood comment'
item.description: Carly Fiorina said Donald Trump's comments about Megyn Kelly "were completely inappropriate and offensive" and were clearly meant to imply the Fox News host's tough questions were a result of menstruation.

item.title: 'I don't want my daughter in room with Trump'
Trump, adviser split
item.description: Donald Trump's campaign said Saturday it has fired top political adviser Roger Stone.

item.title: Boy, 9, is lone survivor of family's desert hike
U.N. accuses North Korea over mines
item.description: U.N. forces on Monday said North Korea was behind a landmine explosion last week that wounded two South Korean soldiers in the demilitarized zone that separates the two countries.

item.title: Predawn stampede kills 10 in India
item.description: A stampede left at least 10 people dead early Monday morning during religious celebrations in eastern India, authorities said.

item.title: Deaths as typhoon lashes China
item.description: At least a dozen people have died and five are missing in the eastern Chinese city of Wenzhou in the wake of Typhoon Soudelor, according to the state-run Xinhua news agency, which cited local disaster management officials.

item.title: Watch typhoon blow car away
item.description: Captivating video shows a typhoon sweeping a car clear out of sight on a road in Taiwan.

item.title: Football legend Frank Gifford dies
item.description: American football legend Frank Gifford, the Pro Football Hall of Famer who enjoyed a successful transition to the broadcast booth, died Sunday of natural causes in his Connecticut home, his family said.

item.title: Hiker killed by grizzly bear
item.description: A preliminary investigation into a hiker's death in Yellowstone National Park suggests the man was attacked by a grizzly bear.

item.title: Lennox daughter pulled from river
item.description: The search continued Sunday for the boyfriend of Tali Lennox Fruchtmann, daughter of singer Annie Lennox, after the couple's kayak capsized in New York's Hudson River.

item.title: Syrians in Damascus: Our fears
item.description: Many Syrians believe that the U.S. strikes against ISIS make little difference in the overall fight. CNN's Fred Pleitgen reports.

item.title: Hotel shoot-out leaves 12 dead
item.description: Twelve people -- including five Malian soldiers -- died as a result of a hostage situation and ensuing battle between the attackers and soldiers at a Mali hotel, Malian state-run broadcaster ORTM reported Saturday.

item.title: Cop fatally shoots college athlete
item.description: An unarmed Texas college football player who was fatally shot by police didn't comply with officers' initial calls to surrender, Arlington Police Chief Will Johnson said Saturday.

item.title: Soccer: West Ham stuns Arsenal
item.description: The first major upset of the English Premier League season saw West Ham beat Arsenal for the first time in eight years with a 2-0 victory at the Emirates Stadium Sunday.

item.title: Man snags 14-foot tiger shark
item.description: A South Carolina fisherman was out with friends when he snagged a 900 pound, 14-foot tiger shark. CNN affiliate WCIV has more.

item.title: Brightest meteor shower due
item.description: A moonless evening could give stargazers a fantastic light show next week.

item.title: Obama: U.S. credibility on line in Iran nuclear deal
'You can realize dreams right here'
item.description: Following Barack Obama's speech at the Global Entrepreneurship summit in Nairobi, we take a look at the most important things the U.S. president had to say to entrepreneurs.

item.title: Opinion: Paid parental leave is a right
item.description: Netflix's one-year paid leave will help it retain its best talent, and it's also the right thing to do.

item.title: Ferguson a year on: Will changes last?
item.description: When black teenager Michael Brown lay dead on a Ferguson street, shot by a white police officer, it happened in a town with a white mayor, white city manager, white police chief and a nearly all-white police force.

item.title: Why vinyl fans don't actually listen to vinyl
item.description: More people are buying vinyl -- but not necessarily to listen to ...

item.title: Guru convicted: 'He held absolute power'
item.description: As young girls in the 1990s, Shyama Rose and sisters Kate and Vesla Tonnessen loved living in Barsana Dham, the Austin, Texas, ashram of the International Society for Divine Love.

item.title: 10 best places to snorkel
item.description: It's a common holiday letdown.

item.title: This is a pencil drawing
item.description: The images you are about to see may shock or confound you. When portraiture looks this realistic, it can be hard to accept that what you see is just paint on a canvas, or ink scratches on a page.

item.title: Is Korean food ready to take over the world?
40 Taiwanese foods we can't live without
item.description: Small eats, and a lot of them, are the big thing in Taiwan.

item.title: Incredible landscapes made out of food
item.description: "Stop playing with your food!"

item.title: Spurs kick off new season with own goal
'Money Man' Mayweather eyes one last payday
Ronaldo 'I don't give a f**k' about FIFA
The world's 12 best spots for wild swimming
The psychedelic world of Indian truck art
'Hell filled with beautiful women, no mirrors'
What if fashion's next big thing was unwearable?
7 ways to spot someone is being trafficked
Opinion: The myth of child prostitution
item.description: Last week saw the premiere of "Children for Sale: The Fight to End Human Trafficking," which exposes the hidden realities of child sex trafficking in the United States. It's a powerful documentary. But there's even more to the story.

item.title: Countries ranked: Who's fighting trafficking?
item.description: Cuba, Kenya and Saudi Arabia are doing better at fighting human trafficking. Egypt, Ghana and Bulgaria are doing worse.

item.title: New Suez Canal a symbol of Sisi's leadership?
item.description: CNN's Hala Gorani speaks to the Council on Foreign Relations' Steven Cook about the current state of Egypt and the work being done by President Abdel Fattah al-Sisi.

item.title: 'Whale Whisperers' wins Nat Geo contest
item.description: Sarah Polger discusses the most recent winners of National Geographic's traveler photo contest.

item.title: Six tons of cocaine seized from submarine
item.description: The U.S. Coast Guard intercepted a 40-foot homemade submarine carrying $181 million worth of drugs.

item.title: A painted journey in Singapore
item.description: CNN's Victoria Kennedy talks with internationally acclaimed artist and athlete Gregory Burns about his works of art.

item.title: Atomic bomb survivor shares survival story
item.description: Seventy years ago Chisako Takeoka survived the world's first attack with an atomic bomb. Since then, she has traveled the world sharing the horrors of her experience. Ivan Watson has her story.

item.title: Will Rio be ready for next year's Olympics?
item.description: CNN's Shasta Darlington takes a look at what Rio de Janerio is doing to get ready for the 2016 Olympic games.

item.title: Drawings show haunting memories of Hiroshima
Must-ride bicycle trips
item.description: The magic of the open road, trail or mountain has long captured the imaginations of cyclists, whether they are professional riders or weekend warriors.

item.title: 11 inspiring African proverbs
item.description: We asked our Twitter followers to send us their favorite African proverbs and tag them #CNNAfricanProverbs. These are 11 of our favorites.

item.title: Paid parental leave is a right, not a favor
Lessons from the ashes of Hiroshima
Beirut's 1960s jet-set playgrounds
item.description: For several decades the name "Beirut" has conjured images of devastation and danger.

item.title: Buildings on verge of destruction
item.description: Go see them now, before it's too late: threatened by neglect, the elements, changing architectural trends or ruthless developers, these outstanding buildings are all fighting a hard battle for survival.

item.title: World's 10 most scenic airport approaches
item.description: For jaded air travelers, window seats are overrated.

item.title: Ruins of the Soviet space shuttle program
item.description: What was once the gleaming pride and joy of the Soviet space program now lies covered in dirt and bird droppings in a disused hangar in Kazakhstan.

item.title: NASA finds 'Earth's bigger, older cousin'
item.description: NASA said Thursday that its Kepler spacecraft has spotted "Earth's bigger, older cousin": the first nearly Earth-size planet to be found in the habitable zone of a star similar to our own.

item.title: 10 watches that changed history
item.description: Mechanical watchmaking is not a world of revolutions, it's a world of evolutions, where change comes only slowly and tradition is a sacred trust. In the five hundred or so years that watches have existed, however, there have been a few that have changed the watchmaking world. Some of these watches broke new ground in design, some in technology -- and some both. Here are ten that made history and became part of it at the same time.

item.title: Girl from Vietnam War photo: Where is she?
item.description: Even without the benefit of context, the image of a naked 9-year-old girl running for her life is as searing and indelible today as it was 43 years ago.

item.title: Capturing beauty around the world
item.description: To photographer Mihaela Noroc, beauty cannot be defined by one country, race or ethnicity.

item.title: The homeowners who refused to budge
